title: 2020 Republican National Convention
added: A report released in October by the office of United States Senator [[Elizabeth Warren]], compiled by her staff, on potential Hatch Act violations by the Trump administration cited this as one of Patton's potential Hatch Act violations.<ref name="Warrenreport">{{cite web |title=LAWLESSNESS AND DISORDER: The Corrupt Trump Administration Has Made A Mockery of the Hatch Act |url=https://www.boston.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Hatch-Act-Violations-by-Trump-Administration-Final.pdf |publisher=Office of Senator Elizabeth Warren |accessdate=14 November 2020 |date=October 2020}}</ref>

title: 2020 Republican National Convention
deleted: The convention was a [[National Special Security Event]].

title: 2020 Republican National Convention
added: The Republican National Convention was originally to be a [[National Special Security Event]]. The originally-planned Charlotte convention had been awarded this status.<ref>{{cite web |last=Berky |first=Rad |title=Secret Service gives update on security for 2020 RNC |url=https://www.wcnc.com/article/news/politics/rnc/secret-service-gives-update-on-security-for-2020-rnc/275-4c37fd7f-c08e-451e-a6c4-c6aa165f248c |website=wcnc.com |accessdate=15 November 2020 |date=14 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=CDP preps responders for 2020 Republican National Convention - Center for Domestic Preparedness |url=https://cdp.dhs.gov/news-media/article/cdp-preps-responders-for-2020-republican-national-convention |website=cdp.dhs.gov |publisher=Department of Homeland Security |accessdate=15 November 2020}}</ref> The plans for a convention in Jacksonville had also been awarded this status.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Scanlan |first1=Dan |title=Jacksonville receives federal Special Security Event designation for upcoming RNC |url=https://www.jacksonville.com/story/news/local/2020/07/07/jacksonville-receives-federal-special-security-event-designation-for-upcoming-rnc/41714227/ |website=The Florida Times-Union |accessdate=15 November 2020 |date=7 July 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Jacksonville approved for federal grant to pay for RNC rally security |url=https://www.actionnewsjax.com/news/politics/jacksonville-approved-federal-grant-pay-rnc-rally-security/F6CA6JDGIVDTJNFYTM4VXNAG24/ |website=WJAX |accessdate=15 November 2020 |date=6 July 2020}}</ref>

title: 2020 Republican National Convention
added: Charlotte businessman John Lassiter served as the president and [[CEO]] of the Charlotte 2020 Host Committee.<ref name="Charlotte2020hostcommittee1">{{cite web |title=Charlotte 2020 Host Committee Welcomes 2020 Republican National Convention; Announces President and CEO, Co-chairs – Charlotte 2020 Host Committee |url=https://charlottein2020.com/charlotte-2020-host-committee-welcomes-2020-republican-national-convention-announces-president-and-ceo-co-chairs |accessdate=15 November 2020 |language=en}}</ref> Ned Curran, Doug Lebda, and Walter Price served as co-chairs.<ref name="Charlotte2020hostcommittee1"/>

The host committee appointed Stephanie Batsell as its volunteer coordinator, John Burleson as its communications director, Heather Dodgins as its director of donor engagement, Haley Habenicht as its events manager, Rachel Kelley as its finance director, and Stephanie Speers as its accounting manager.<ref>{{cite web |title=Charlotte 2020 Host Committee announces staff appointments – Charlotte 2020 Host Committee |url=https://charlottein2020.com/charlotte-2020-host-committee-announces-staff-appointments |accessdate=15 November 2020 |language=en}}</ref>

title: 2020 Republican National Convention
added: The display was created by Grucci Inc.m, and cost the Trump campaign $477,000.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Stein |first1=Lachlan Markay,Sam |title=Trump Campaign Spent Nearly Half a Million on Fireworks |url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/the-trump-campaign-spent-nearly-half-a-million-on-convention-fireworks |website=The Daily Beast |accessdate=16 November 2020 |language=en |date=22 September 2020}}</ref>

title: 2020 Republican National Convention
added: The convention, as originally planned to be held in Charlotte, was initially anticipated to attract 50,000 visitors to the city.<ref name="mum">{{cite web |last1=Hud |title=Charlotte Business Journal |url=https://www.bizjournals.com/charlotte/news/2020/06/03/local-host-committee-execs-mum-on-rnc-controversy.html |website=www.bizjournals.com |publisher=Charlotte Business Journal |date=3 June 2020}}</ref>
